title: Steamtyme
author: Steamtyme
content: I've never had to go this route before so I'm a bit lost on what services have a solid reputation and are reliable. I'll looking to cashout USD giftcards for Bitcoin probably once or twice a month depending.

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: How much are you talking about?You have Paxful and https://agoradesk.com and a few others but you are going to take a big percentage hit in GC value vs what you get at least in the beginning until you have a decent reputation.For small amounts, it may be better to sell for fiat in some of the more popular gift card sites and convert to BTCOr, you could always try to sell them here.-Dave

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: Quote from: Steamtyme on December 06, 2022, 04:36:25 PMI've never had to go this route before so I'm a bit lost on what services have a solid reputation and are reliable. I'll looking to cashout USD giftcards for Bitcoin probably once or twice a month depending.If you want to cash out physical gift cards, your chances of getting paid are greater than trying to sell digital giftcards cards.Sites you can use:Forum Digital Products board: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=93.0P2P Binance trading with escrow:Paxfulhttps://bitify.com/Social networking sites and you will find some, but you need to make a good discount.Selling digital gift cards would be a waste of your time.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Quote from: Husires on December 07, 2022, 11:06:40 AM-snip-Last time I checked, Binance P2P didn't support gift cards as a payment method.@OP Maybe you can check G2A. I'm not sure if they pay their sellers in BTC but I know that buyers can pay using BTC.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on December 07, 2022, 12:24:05 PMLast time I checked, Binance P2P didn't support gift cards as a payment method.I think he's talking about Binance software where you can able to buy and send that support multiple cryptos but you can only redeem them through Binance and it's not listed on their P2P exchange. So this is not OP looking for @OP there is no other option but Paxful and G2A only that accept gift cards that I know there is also Coincola never tested it but it was mentioned here many times.

comments.author: Steamtyme
comments.body: Thanks for the replies. I'll check them out and figure out my best option from there. Ideally I sort something else out and don't need to cashout via giftcards, but now I have my options.

comments.author: GoatPharmer
comments.body: Did you find a solution? seems this is fluid so my solution from a couple years is different today. would appreciate hearing yours if you found it

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Quote from: GoatPharmer on February 05, 2024, 07:38:38 PMDid you find a solution? seems this is fluid so my solution from a couple years is different today. would appreciate hearing yours if you found itI'm still not aware of any solutions except what has been suggested above. So once again, your best bet would be to sell to other individuals, or use those gift cards to buy whatever items and then resell those to crypto, or fiat and then use that to buy crypto.

comments.author: tyz
comments.body: I was talking to a friend about this recently. He regularly uses CoinCola.com and said he has had good experiences so far. You can give it a try. As I said, I haven't had the experience myself, I've only heard about it. Therefore without guarantee!
